Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location”
Reviews.Author: IntSomellier
Reviews.Content: Hotel du Fort is a comfortable hotel just off rue Ste. Catherine. It is small and well run. Rooms are spacious and on both occasions we visited had a superb view of the city. Breakfast is simple but has a lot of choice for the vegetarian or meat lover. Late check-out 2-3 pm is a wonderful idea. The hotel is well situated with walking to all major downtown attraction, bars and restaurants. The Metro is just minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Spring in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: reginladysmith
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Montreal especially to see our grand daughter going to Magill.Found Hotel deFort on Groupon. And what a deal!.Hotel is close to down town and all the attractions ,plus walking distance to Mcgill univesrity.Metro was easy to find from the hotel and took you every where you wanted to go in the city for a mere $5.00 a day.This hotel did not disappoint us in any way. We spent four nites,were upgraded to a beautiful corner suite that had a city view plus a view of St.Catherine st.We even watched the two hour St. Paddies parade from the comfort of our room.This is one of Montreal's hotels that should not be left off your travel plans. We will be staying there again on our next visit to a city that had record breaking hot weather for March, wonderful restaurants and wonderful people. The Manns Ladysmith,B.C.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place and Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: rjcvg
Reviews.Content: I stay here for business about 4 times a year. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Rooms are large and very clean. Very comfortable beds. Bathroom is small but adequate. Frig and microwave in all rooms I think. Small business center with computer and printer on second floor. Free to use. There is also a breakfast served on the second floor. Very nice but cost $11. We just walked down St. Catherine street, (just a few steps away) to a wonder place called Paris Crepes and had breakfast there. There is no shortage of restaurants on and off St. Cat's.

Reviews.Title: “Good option near downtown”
Reviews.Author: Torquay102010
Reviews.Content: I found the staff at the front desk really excellent. I was upgraded to a suite, and the room was large and bright with a small fridge and microwave. Breakfast is available but they have no restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Over a decade of excellent service...”
Reviews.Author: L S
Reviews.Content: Our group has been coming up to Montreal for the last 13 years to attend the Canadian Grand Prix. Due to the size of the group and the fact that we drive up in 10-15 cars, we have a unique set of requirements for a hotel. Without fail, the staff at Hotel du Fort always produces an exceptional package for us. From the high quality of service to the secured, underground parking (so important to a car club), Hotel du Fort always makes sure our trip is most enjoyable. We've stayed here 13 times and plan to for many more years. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Can't lose at Hotel du Fort”
Reviews.Author: HungryTerry
Reviews.Content: Very nice room, comfortable bed, front desk courteous, could have used help with baggage, good variety breakfast, expensive parking beneath the hotel ($19 for 24hrs) but no choice in that area, very little room in front of hotel for unloading.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL!”
Reviews.Author: mary11mary
Reviews.Content: Just lovely! I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough- just make sure about parking,if you are driving your own car,it can be pricey. The service is wonderful,the rooms are so crisp,clean and fresh. Very good for the money as compared to others in my Town Montreal! What I love especially is the fact that there are so many little restaurants in a block or 2 in the immediate area,and it is right on the main street of Rue St Catherine,but a quiet spot- I really love this hotel! I think you will love it too!

Reviews.Title: “Decent, clean hotel for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Dany_in_BKK
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at this hotel during a short trip to Montreal. The location is quite close to McGill university, so there are quite a few decent and affordable pubs and restaurants in the surrounding area and you see life on the street even later in the evening! The hotel itself is more like a 3-star venue and the rooms are quite spacious and clean. Despite it being relatively well maintained, it does have an 80's look and feel to it and could use a major overhaul/modernization. The room equipment is fully functional yet definitely from the past millennium. This is definitely a hotel for short stays or just spending the night because the gloominess of the rooms literally pushes you out to see the world outside! It is no surprise that this hotel is a favourite among business travellers, who often just need a clean and affordable place to spend a night or two. While the room rates weren't exactly cheap, the hotel was far better value than some other places we've looked at.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot”
Reviews.Author: TerryinAylmer
Reviews.Content: Stayed in January, 2012. Very well appointed room, quite spacious and very well kept, very clean. Stayed in a "Signature Room" which was more than adequate. Located about 6 blocks from the shopping district which is an easy walk. Buffet breakfast was good and the dining room staff was very attentive and pleasant. Parking is available right next door for around $20. Might be nice to have some music in the room, as there is only a TV, no way to play local radio. etc.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Prix weekend”
Reviews.Author: gLoBe-HoPpErMaN
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during Montreal's busiest weekend. We were in one of their excellent 2 room, 1 1/2 bath suites on the top floors so this definitely slants my opinion towards the positive. The rooms were very clean, the staff courteous and professional, breakfasts satisfying and the hotel is in close proximity to the city center. The 2 blocks down the street from the hotel heading towards city center are a little rundown but we were never bothered by it. We look forward to going to Montreal and staying at the du Fort again

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Location, Moderately Priced”
Reviews.Author: AmblesideInn-Host
Reviews.Content: We regularly stay at Hotel du Fort, when visiting our Montreal family. We find that the rooms are consistently clean and the staff consistently helpful. The moderate price leaves us feeling that we have received good value for what we have paid. Although the choice of pillow is a somewhat personal thing, the only suggestion I might make is to have a pillow option that is a little firmer. Other than that, the quiet atmosphere always contributes to a good night's rest. The complimentary Wifi was a great value added addition on this visit.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Norma I
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Montreal over the weekend (Jan 6, 2012 to Jan 8, 2012). I was very disappointed the pictures you see online are nothing what the room actually looks like. Also; I spent a long time looking for somewhere to stay while my fiance and I were in Montreal for the weekend. One thing I was looking for and the reason I decided on this hotel was because it offered smoking rooms. But one we got there we went to out room which said non-smoking. My fiance went to ask the gentleman at the front desk and he indicated it was a non-smoking hotel. Now reading past review; there are smoking rooms. That was something important for us (being smokers). The rooms were very clean; but when my fiance was getting out of the shower he grab a towel to dry off and they were completely filthy. Basically we feel the advertising on this hotel is false....and not what we were expecting at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: modesttraveller30s
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a weekend with friends and the hotel was very clean, comfortable and spacious. I would go again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Montreal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hollysmom83
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a downtown Montreal hotel near the Metro and found a Living Social deal for the Hotel DuFort, What a lucky event! This was a wonderful hotel that served our needs perfectly. The room was very large, absolutely immaculate, and very quiet for being so close to the elevator. The Signature room contained a sofa bed for the kids. This location was excellent for walking and experiencing the local culture - and close to the underground mall for my teen daughter. Grocery stores, post office, even a little cafe in the LaSalle College Student Center for a quick snack when you don't want to get out in the weather. Parking was a challenge - but I was driving a Grand Cherokee - so I had to search for a larger space. However, the garage was warm and dry. Getting in and out of town to/from the hotel was very easy. Sean was a huge help - advising us as to local sights and providing us directions. The maid who cleaned the 11th floor was very nice. The buffet breakfast was included with our package - eggs, pastries, ham, wonderful croissants, fruit, cereal, toast, etc. Very nice breakfast room also. We plan to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great find!!”
Reviews.Author: herzy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I try to stay in different hotels whenever we come to Montreal to experience different neighborhoods. Hotel du Fort, though further west than our other hotels, turned out to be located minutes from the AMC multiplex and around the corner from Kazu, an amazing little (and I mean little!) Japanese restaurant. We reserved a queen room for Friday and Saturday nights at a 25 percent discount, a winter sale. Our room was spacious, attractively furnished, spotless, with a superb mattress and linens. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Chambermaids offered extra towels and the receptionists were efficient and engaging. It was so quiet both mornings that we overslept! We will definitely return to this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the heart of Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Frolla_32
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Du Fort twice. The first time because we trusted the travelers' reviews on Tripadvisor, and the second time because we wanted nothing else but Hotel Du Fort. The hotel stands out in a lot of ways. First of all, it is conveniently located in the center of the city. One can easily walk to many great restaurants and main attractions from the hotel. Secondly, the hotel used to be an apartment complex, which was later converted into a hotel. Therefore, the rooms are spacious with large, from floor to ceiling, windows. Another feature which you will most certainly appreciate is the underground garage. But of course, the most important thing of all, is how the hotel's guests are treated. Without any doubt, the hotel personnel prides itself in delivering excellent service. And they sure do deliver! The staff is very pleasant and extremely helpful. The rooms and bathrooms are meticulously clean. Beds are very comfortable, and kitchenettes are modern. We had everything we needed and more. Our last stay fell on the early dates in October, 2011. The room was on the 15th floor with a spectacular view of Mount Royal. Our trip to Montreal that time was significant to my husband and I - we were celebrating our 5-year wedding anniversary. Somehow the manager of the hotel found that out, and arranged for a bottle of champagne and delicious treats along with a heartfelt congratulations note signed by her to be brought up into the room before our arrival. My husband and I were deeply moved by that gesture. As we learned afterwards, such approach is the hotel's common practice.I think they truly strive to make your stay memorable. There is no false advertising or wrong message. They are what they are, and they are exceptional. -Olga and Mike, Dover, NH, USA.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: velojmp
Reviews.Content: Large rooms, good value and location (walk east and find some of the best asian restaurants downtown....). Walking west on Ste-Catherine is less interesting. Some of the furnishings and decor are dated but not too much and the size of the rooms, cost and service make up for the aesthetics of the place. Good value overall.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: RDandCT
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location (downtown Montreal at the corner of du Fort and Ste-Catherine Street). You can easily access Montrealâ€™s main expressways and you are within walking distance to three metro (subway) stations as well as many of the cityâ€™s fine restaurants, shopping malls, and attractions. The room we stayed in was spacious and clean and had a kitchenette/wet bar. Our stay also included a buffet breakfast with hot and cold items: variety of breads, cereals, croissants & muffins, yogurt, fruits, cheese, ham, scrambled eggs, and traditional baked beans made with maple syrup! There is parking next door which will cost you $18.75 plus tax. Your best bet is to park the car and purchase a Metro day pass ($8.00) especially if you plan to use the Metro more than 3 times during the day otherwise it will cost you $3.00 per trip. The check in staff were friendly and helpful especially when it came to navigating us towards Old Montreal and some of the other tourist attractions Montreal has to offer. If you enjoy a good beer I would recommend Les 3 Brasseurs. This is a microbrewery restaurant in Old Montreal that offers an authentic beer-tasting experience you wonâ€™t find anywhere else. The beer is brewed right on site. They also offer a four 4 oz beer sampler called â€œEt Ceteriaâ€� and a variety of Beer Cocktails are on the menu as well. This restaurant is definitely worth a try.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PhilGab
Reviews.Content: The Hotel du Forte is a very nice hotel if you are seeking a no frills place to stay for a weekend trip. The room was very clean and equipped with a fridge, microwave, sink and safe. I agree that there is an unusual odor in the small lobby but this is not a problem as you would not be spending much time there. The fitness is adequate for basic workouts. The buffet breakfast ($10.95) was limited and a better option would be Tutti Fruittiâ€™s which is 3 blocks away across from the mall. The area has many good ethnic restaurants (Thai, Turkish, Swiss, Greek, etc.). The grocery store across the street is very convenient for snacks, beer and wine. A mall and a large movie complex are a few blocks away on St. Catherineâ€™s. The nearest metro is Atwater (inside the mall). We had a problem using many of the area ATMâ€™s as they would not recognize the PIN for my checking account; I withdrew from my savings instead. The local stores will only allow cash back if you have a debit card without a Visa or MasterCard logo. A few notes on the area attractions: Vieux-Montreal is too touristy with the exception of the Montreal Museum of Archaeology & History which is excellent. The fine arts museum (Musee des Beaux-Arts) is also very good but donâ€™t bother with the McCord Museum which has a small exhibit of Montreal history but is not worth the $13 entrance fee. The largest exhibit was two floors of pictures of oil refineries and oil drills.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: bk160
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel du Fort October 17 and 18, 2011. The staff was very responsive to our questions regarding where to eat and places to visit. The room was very nice, a large corner room on the 17th floor. Good location, close to the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience I ever had with a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: tawda
Reviews.Content: There was a strong and pervasive urine-like odor in the lobby throughout my stay. It was not particularly hot outside (temperature data on weather.com shows the temperature ranged from 14 to 27 degrees Celsius). It became apparent almost immediately that members of the hotel staff were incompetent and rude. We stayed at the hotel as part of a wedding group, and the staff was supposed to deliver gift bags to our rooms, which they didn't. At the groom's urging, we went downstairs to pick ours up from the front desk. The staffperson there inquired suspiciously as to whether we had just been in our rooms. When we said yes, she muttered that this didn't make sense because the staff had just tried to deliver the bags, so if we'd been in our rooms we should have received ours. Primarily what prompts this review, however, is the hotel's refusal to accept responsibility when it became clear that the maid had thrown out my orthodontic retainers -- which I left drying in the bathroom over the side of a glass. Replacing the retainers thanks to the maid's error will cost me over $700. But getting someone from the hotel to even return my calls, let alone do anything but patronize or BS me, was an ordeal. When I arrived home and began unpacking my things, I realized that the retainers had not been where I left them in the hotel bathroom (dangling over a glass). The maid had rinsed the glasses and turned them upside down, and apparently discarded what was resting on them. I immediately called the hotel and asked them to check if the maids had found my retainers. They transferred me to the voicemail of the "Executive Housekeeper," who did not return my call until 5 days later. I called again the next day, and when the person at the desk answered in what sounded like French, I asked if it would be alright if I spoke English. He snippily said, "Well I just spoke English, so yes." He told me the maids had found nothing, and that the only hotel employees who could tell me whether the hotel had insurance or any other way to compensate me would be out of the office for another 5 days. I was forwarded to the voicemail of one such alleged person, left a message, and waited 5 days, but she didn't call me back either. So after 5 days I called again and spoke with another "manager" who purported to know nothing about the hotel's insurance or whether the hotel could reimburse me and said he would need to consult the person whose return call I was still awaiting. Later that day, he called me to say the hotel has no insurance to cover my situation, but that he recommends I investigate whether I have my own insurance that might compensate me. For example, he told me, another hotel manager once had a houseguest whose personal insurance compensated her when a dog ate her shoes. Not helpful. When I asked him to confirm that the hotel has no insurance FOR WHEN EMPLOYEES DESTROY GUESTS' PROPERTY, he confirmed, and told me, irrelevantly, that the hotel's deductible for damage to its own common areas is so high that once upon a time, when a teenage guest opened a fire sprinkler and caused $14K damage to a stairwell, the tour group had to assess each teenager $100 to compensate the hotel. When I pointed out the story's irrelevance, he cut to the chase and tells me the hotel policy is to never cover valuables left in the room outside the safe. I explained that my wet retainer, left drying over a glass in the bathroom, is "valuable" to no one but me -- in that respect similar to a wet toothbrush -- and is not like money or electronics that belong in a safe. I also explained that in this case I'm not claiming something was stolen, but that a hotel employee destroyed something. And then he simply became ridiculous, treating me as though I were making a false claim or simply a fool. He asked whether I had inquired about the retainer before checking out. I re-explained my timeline and again noted the irrelevance of his question, as maids are never supposed to throw these things out. He then said, in ultimate double-speak, that he's "sorry" about what happened but actually doesn't believe the maid would have discarded the retainers "because they're trained not to do that, and I'm "making a serious accusation." (Apparently the maids at Hotel du Fort never make mistakes, and saying somebody mistook a retainer for garbage is a "very serious accusation.") I told him I'm not fabricating the story and offered to send him a copy of the orthodontic bill. I also explained that even the world's best maid might mistake a clear retainer for garbage. He again said he's "sorry" and knows how people "freak out" about orthodontia, but while he believes I lost the retainers, he doesn't believe they came to be lost in the way I claim. I tell him it's hardly an apology when the hotel doesn't take any responsibility. Then he resorted to asking if I checked my luggage carefully, and I suggested that instead of going around in circles like this he get back to me after he checks with his alleged manager (the one with the helpful story about the dog) re compensation. He later called to say that the hotel will not reimburse me for my stay because "there is nothing we can do about it" (of course there is - they can reimburse me for my stay!), but if I want to come back again, they'll be happy to upgrade me "at the best rate ever." What a joke. Don't stay here. And if you do, cram everything into the safe, including your wet dental items.

Reviews.Title: “NIce for a budget trip”
Reviews.Author: Alebello
Reviews.Content: Rooms are good enough, clean and spacious bathroom are not very big but with bath tube and confortable location is not in the center but is quiet and very close to the main streets for shopping we have ejoyed our stay and the people at the hotel were very kind with us

Reviews.Title: “Very decent”
Reviews.Author: adorocuba
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked using Hotwire. Great site if you don't mind surprises. I was initially disappointed in the location. It's about a half hour walk from Old Montreal which is fine but the area it's in seems a little rundown and geared towards students. Not surprising since it is close to Concordia U. After eating a big meal in Old Montreal the walk was welcome! The lobby is small and nice, staff are polite. We had a corner room on the 11th floor. It was big and clean with a coffee machine, fridge and microwave. The furniture is dated but solid. The bed was perfectly fine and not rock hard as I have seen some people describe them. Bathroom clean and in great condition with nice shampoo conditioner and soap. A good stay but in my opinion I think the Rating on hotwire should be 3 not 3 1/2.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous experience”
Reviews.Author: Marlene A
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel to be everything I'd want in decor, service and amenities. The room was clean & comfortable, the staff extremely helpful & the breakfast buffet had variety to suit all tastes, and an impeccable staff. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Marlene Aarons

Reviews.Title: “Great for a girls trip”
Reviews.Author: Shybland
Reviews.Content: My husband sent myself and best friend away to this hotel for my 35th birthday. My husband and I previously stayed at this hotel a year ago. What we really loved about the hotel were the accommodations, location, and atmosphere. The hotel is located in the same building as a college. So across the street is a restaurant and bar that is open for breakfast, lunch, dinner, and then after hours. The restaurant is a sports bar that has good food and is very reasonable. You are also in walking distance to shopping and other restaurants. We really enjoyed ourselves on our girls trip. My friend can not wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff but rooms could use reno.”
Reviews.Author: lawgman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at Hotel du Fort 4 or 5 times over the last 5 years. The staff is friendly, the location is convenient (west tip of down-town â€“ easily walkable to major attractions so I am not sure why people complain about the location). The rooms we get are great in size and layout, allowing for my kids to sleep in one room and my wife and I in another. However, my upcoming trip will be the first trip in a long time staying somewhere else. The rooms, while great in size, have simply become too worn (and stained), including the carpets, and curtains and furniture. The soap and shampoo dispensers, while a great idea, just seem cheap to me. The rooms need a reno badly. If they ever do get redone, I will be backâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Enormous rooms and great location”
Reviews.Author: Passagerare
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite with separate bedroom and were amazed by the amount of space. Large living area with sofa-bed, table for four and kitcenette, as well as a powder room off the hall. The bedroom was extremely large (two easy chairs, a corner make-up table, lots of cupboard space) and the whole unit was clean. The sofa-bed was already folded out (for our son) as we arrived in the late evening. Breakfast (extra) offered a reasonable variety of pastries, fruit, yogurt, cereal but there was no bacon/cooked eggs. At $10.95 a person, it was reasonable value and seating/buffet service worked well. Free newspapers in the lobby and helpful staff. If one is a CAA/AAA member, parking is free and the garage (right next door) is spacious, compared to many, with good access to the lobby but no direct elevator access to the upper floors. Easy walking from the hotel to St. Catherine/De Maisonneuve Street/Boulevard Rene Levesque attractions (e.g. Canadian Centre for Architecture) and Concordia University is two blocks away. Easy access to Autoroute Ville Marie at the foot of Fort Street. Overall, excellent value for large rooms in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently good”
Reviews.Author: ExBCer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice in the past couple of months. Best experience both times. Centrally located a few feet from St. Catherine's, it's near Atwater Metro station. Friendly staff, clean, nice rooms, good shower (I am very particular). I really liked the shampoo, conditioner, soap dispenser. Fridge in room (no mini-bar). Free wifi. Easy underground parking. Limited TV, couldn't figure out if there was any on-demand programming (who cares). Didn't use the breakfast facilities (too many choices right outside the door).

Reviews.Title: “Seriously great staff! Good room. OK location.”
Reviews.Author: phillytraveler71
Reviews.Content: I was here for six days with my husband (hrees73) and I second everything he said. Great room -- actually a suite with mini-kitchen, couch and chair and workspace -- in a safe, convenient, collegiate location at a good price. The front desk staff, however, are awesome. As we stayed, we threw any number of questions at them, which they handled speedily and with skill. They even directed us to the local laundromat so we didn't need to pay for the in-house service. The helpfulness of staff can really make a difference in a longer-term stay, and Hotel du Fort does the job.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: Loraleigh_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights on August 18th and we very pleased with our choice of hotel. We purchased a 3-day metro pass for $16.00 at the airport and took the 747express bus into town. The stop was about 5 blocks away but we had small rolling luggage so not a problem. The reception staff were very pleasant and our room was available when we arrived which was an hour before check-in. We booked a classic room and got a corner suite which was large, nicely furnished, clean, and very comfortable. Breakfast was included in our rate. I thought that the price was fair and included choices of cereal, bread/croissants, juices, cheese, yogurt, fruit, scrambled eggs, cold ham, and endless coffee. The metro stop at Guy-Concordia is by far the nearest. We liked the surrounding area for restaurants, small boutique shopping, grocery store across the street, easy walk to the metro and shopping further down St. Catherine's Street. Compared to a Vancouver hotel in the middle of August, this hotel is great value and you get a good quiet night's sleep. We would recommend Hotel Du Fort and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Staff couldn't have been any nicer. Great value!”
Reviews.Author: Mary M
Reviews.Content: We've been to Montreal several times, and in the past have stayed in a different, lovely location not too far from the Hotel du Fort. Although lovely, I've never felt that the value was good. This year, I looked around a little more, and found the Hotel du Fort. The price was approximately $100 less/night, parking was less expensive, and there was no $20/day charge for wireless. Still, it was unknown to us, and that gave us a little pause. We decided to give it a try, and boy are we glad we did!!! It was a WONDERFUL value!!! The bed was very comfortable, the room spacious, the bathroom spacious, a microwave and refridgerator in the room added convenience. We had in/out priviledges with our underground parking garage (at the other hotel, it was valet, and you had to plan approximately 15 min. ahead of time, as it was not necessarily parked on premise, plus tipping added to the already higher cost of parking). The staff was great! They were friendly and helpful with any questions. There were no extra costs for anything -- I rec'd a 2 page fax, needed to print out several pages of work, and needed a copy made -- all free of cost, all of which the staff took care of for me personally. No charge for use of the business center for anything if you used it (my thumb drive wasn't recognized for some reason, so staff printed out the work I needed). The location is great! Near restaurants, stores, post office, and Metro stops. This is definitely our "new" hotel when in Montreal. Every aspect was pleasant. Oh, the workout facility was great, too! I was sick when we got to Montreal, so I didn't use it, but my husband did, and I had looked at it hoping to use it -- balance balls, BOSU, yoga mats, weights, good cardio equipment, Not a full fitness center, but more than adequate to maintain/improve your fitness while you stay. And, again, the staff was just so nice! A breakfast buffet is available for a reasonable charge, however we have some favorite places to go, so we didn't partake. It did look good, we just chose to go to restaurants that we have been to in the past.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, a bit far from downtown”
Reviews.Author: hrees73
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 6 days and had a good stay. We had a corner room that was quite spacious for the price, and included a small refrigerator and dishes. There is a food market across the street and plenty of small places to eat nearby, although none are fine dining by any means. Guy-Concordia on the Metro green line is only 2 blocks away, so getting around is easy. The location is OK but lacks the charm of Old Montreal farther downtown. It is still a good value for the money, however.

Reviews.Title: “We were disgusted and will never stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: daphne64
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel we did not see a place to actually leave our car. It was decidedly no frills. We parked our car in the garage ourselves, but then were told we were not supposed to do this. When we entered the hotel lobby via the lobby of some other building, we were met with a stench so powerful that my daughter and I almost immediately turned around and left. It was like a mixture of urine and cleaning fluid. We had an appointment and could stay no longer than getting our car authorized, which they almost denied us because they said we arrived too early. I had never heard of such a thing before. The garage was not full at all either. We wanted to stay elsewhere but other hotels were full. Frequent visitors to Montreal, we've stayed at the Place d'Armes, Omni and Sofitel. Hundreds of times better - and for less money per night. So disappointed, and for the money, a drag. A seedy, dingy part of town that you would otherwise never visit, only about a mile away from the center of downtown, but that is such a better location. Plus, the desk manager was just a know it all and very, very unhelpful. There was no concierge and the staff knows nothing. To top it off our hallway wrecked of body odor. We couldn't figure out why, but it just lingered in the air and in the front of our room. We couldn't care less that our room was large. We did not want to be there at all. At night the wind actually howled outside our windows. Blurg. Never will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Staff tried hard but the place is dirty.”
Reviews.Author: mbw1
Reviews.Content: The hallway to our suite smelled badly. Our suite did not smell but the furniture was old, the carpet was worn and the entire suite needed a rejuvenation. The check in process was strict - suite was not available until 4:00pm but the hotel did not seem full. The staff was very service oriented, especially the floor maids, but their product needs to be improved. I checked a couple other floors and the same disgusting smell was in the hallways.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: NatePodie387
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at Hotel Du Fort for 1 night and found it not worth the price. Despite easy access to the highway, the rooms were almost to big and it felt like wasted space. Altough they claim that the Hotel is in downtown Montreal it is about a 10 minute cab ride to downtown Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: cravydocketoz
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the DuFort and were pleasantly surprised by the friendly and courteous manner of the staff. The only issue was that the hotel does not have a restaurant for lunch or dinner. The breakfast room wascomfortable and the breakfast fine. I would recommend this hotel in its very central position for access to the sights in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, spacious, and staff were very nice and accomodating.”
Reviews.Author: Rhumeaux
Reviews.Content: This was a great find. We drove in from the US (Vermont) and the AAA rate allowed us to park for free, a very nice perk. The room was very clean and comfortable (large and roomy with kitchen sink and fridge). The staff were as pleasant as could be. We wanted to be more west in the city and that worked very well. Good restaurants all around the area. They serve a nice breakfast as well for about $10 per person. Overall good value and we would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for family trip”
Reviews.Author: BluegrassJayhawk
Reviews.Content: Had room for 2 parents, and 3 kids (10, 12, 15) since we brought an air mattress and sleeping bag. More floorspace than most hotels. Nice location not too far from metro stops. Plenty of interesting things to see on St. Catherine Street. Wireless worked, but took a while to get connected, and was not fast.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasure to stay at Hotel Du Fort”
Reviews.Author: phantom_girl00000
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in June 2011. Very pleasant experience! The rooms are large and very comfortable, the hotel itself is situated on one of the main streets in montreal, just far away to not be noisy. We walked most days to old mongrel which tool us a nice stroll of 30-40 mintues, which considering the excellent summer weather was a pleasure. There are so many old beautiful buildings to look at on the way you don't even realize how long you have been walking for. If you do go down to old montreal hang around for dinner, the atmosphere is excellent and the views at sunset are breath taking. Would definately stay at this hotel again! Free wireless which was very nice as well!

Reviews.Title: “For families, much better options available elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: lightupDelhi
Reviews.Content: From time to time my husband needs to come to Montreal for a couple of weeks and the family tags along. We stay in apartment hotels and this time our associates booked us into the Hotel DuFort. All I can say is that this hotel may be okay if you are coming on business for one or two days and don't need to spend time in the hotel, but if you are coming for a while and are with family there are far better options in Montreal. Our two room suite consisted of two large, bright and fairly comfortable rooms, but the sofa bed was lumpy and was replaced with a cot that was no more comfortable. A lot of items in the room looked really old, and were not all functioning well. The rooms here have a microwave and a minibar sized fridge only, so arenot good for keeping supplies or cooking or eating in-room, which is not great if you have kids or are here for some weeks. Nor does the hotel have a pool, or common areas to use, apart from a small fitness centre. The breakfast is limited, not very interesting, and never changes, and unlike the other hotels we have used, there are all kinds of strictures about taking things out of the dining hall. Previously we stayed in a cheaper hotel that was better for everything - large suites, better decor, pool and roof deck, proper kitchen, substantial and good breakfast, and better location (This is on a grungy stretch of an otherwise posh street). I know there are many others such and would look elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, good location downtown”
Reviews.Author: seam_by_seam
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with Hotel du Fort. The staff was alway polite and helpful, and it is quite close to the metro station, restaurants, and shops. Also the rooms are quite large, the bed is comfortable and I really enjoyed the view of downtown Montreal. The decor is a maybe little dated, but that should not discourage you if you are looking for a comfortable, reasonably priced hotel in downtown Montreal. The rooms were quite clean, and the cleaning staff came at reasonable times. And wow, was the hot water hot! There was a sink, along with a mini fridge and microwave. The restaurant also sent up cutlery and dishes for our use upon request. There was a safe but I did not use it. I went out to get croissants for breakfast in bed for my partner, of course I asked for advice, the desk clerk recommended a place nearby, and also told me where I could get the best in the city, but I was looking for somewhere good nearby. I never tried their breakfast. This is located in a younger part of the city I think - lots of students around, bustling with shops and restaurants. Some people might think it's a little rough (graffitti abounds, and you will see homeless people) but I thought it was vibrant and exciting. I also enjoyed the Alexis Nihon park just a block or two away... a pleasant place to pass an hour people watching. I loved Montreal, and would encourage anyone to go. Hotel du Fort definitely contributed to that positive experience. I would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: TWIGGY02
Reviews.Content: The staff at Hotel du Fort was welcoming and accommodating. They readily assisted us with the accommodations, exchange of some funds, and tips about how to traverse the city. The breakfast was abundant and tasty. The underground parking was convenient and not too pricey. Sean, at the front desk was warm and congenial.

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay, not the first and not the last time to come to the du fort”
Reviews.Author: amirskier
Reviews.Content: i really love coming to du fort hotel. great lacation, the best street in montreal,next to the highway,next to the metro station, next to the mal with the best stores. many restaurants. great feeling in the hotel, great service. solve any problem what's so ever. big rooms, big beds, very clean. everything with a smile and very good attitude of the hosts. come every year only to the "du fort" hotel, and will return to the same one the next years.

Reviews.Title: “huge rooms!”
Reviews.Author: jot23
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised with the size of this room and everything that was in it! It's a bit run down and old-fashioned, but for the price it's amazing. There was a whole "kitchenette" section with a sink once you walk in, very convenient. We had a queen bed, I believe, and there was just SO MUCH space in the room that it could've easily fit another one (there's a couch there instead). We had friends that were staying at another hotel, and they would come over and everyone fit comfortably. Pretty good location. Lots of noodle/Pho places right outside; supermarket across the street which was very convenient. Coming from Toronto, a huge surprise was finding beer in the grocery store! We had the breakfast buffet one day and it was quite overpriced and not really worth it, but they had excellent croissants. One problem we had was forgetting to ask for a non-smoking room (actually, I'm not sure if this was even an option) and it was VERY smoky in there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Option in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: LVJ1980
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at the Hotel du Fort. The room exceeded my expectations with a kitchen and sitting area. The location is great and close to the metro, shops, restaurants, etc. I would definitely use this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Small, decent hotel-great employees”
Reviews.Author: MiscRW
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel du Fort for 2 nights end of August. You can leave your luggage at the hotel if you arrive early for check-in. Front desk staff were very helpful in giving directions and finding information for us on the internet. They even helped us to get the best train fares by calling the train station for us. The nearby Atwater metro station is within walking distance by making a right on St Catherine Street. If in Montreal for more than a day and plan to use public transportation the 3-dy metro pass for metro & bus is an economical buy for $14.00 compared to the daily pass of $9.00. The hotel is located a fairly short ride by metro to downtown Montreal and Old Montreal. A lot of shopping is available underground and there is the IGA supermarket if you want to save on food and get fresh fruits. There is also a supermarket nearby on St Catherine Street steps away from the hotel. Hotel was very clean and the service very good. The front desk staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Stayed in one of the Classic rooms on the 17th Floor, which was small, clean & comfortable. There was no free Internet access in room which was a minus. There is a view of downtown, nothing spectacular. A small fridge and microwave are in the room. l. Breakfast at the hotel was served in the St Louis room on the 2nd floor. Dining room was tastefully decorated and the service was friendly and attentive. The buffet was delicious with a wide selection. There are 3 metro stations near to the hotel. Atwater, Guy-Concordia & Vanier Georges. The Post Office is across the street from the hotel and several restaurants and shops on St Catherine Street.

Reviews.Title: “Feel like at home”
Reviews.Author: Caro003
Reviews.Content: Every month I travel and stay downtown Montreal, I have stayed at several places but DuFort is my favourite because I feel like at home and it is quiet. The service is excellent ! never feel you disturb and they take care of everything with no delay. I have been going to DuFort since march 2009 (every month or 2), and am very satisfy. The location is perfect being very close to everything but not right in the noisy part of Mtl, and also the exit to go back on highway is easy to access. Only thing missing is a restaurant for supper time if you do not want to go out, but there is many great restaurant around to discover.

Reviews.Title: “Penalties For Hotwire Users”
Reviews.Author: DavidEats
Reviews.Content: Hotwire has become a habit forus. More often than not, we find great deals in really nice hotels through Hotwire. We were refused the complementary breakfast advertised for the hotel, because we used Hotwire. We were not given the requested bed size, we would have to pay an upgrade charge to get that request, because we used Hotwire. Our advise is to book a four star through Hotwire, because you end up paying the four star price, just to get through the visit. The staff at the desk was very friendly as the added up the extras on our bill. Montreal has become visitor friendly with a few exceptions. This hotel seems to be one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: powerpat_10
Reviews.Content: Spent 9 days in this hotel and found the staff to be very good and the staff to br quite helpful. The housekeeping staff were very, very good. The hotel was close to all off the restaurants and clubs as well it was directly across from supermarket/liquor store. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel at a reasonable price!”
Reviews.Author: CariocaGringo
Reviews.Content: I found the Hotel du Fort to be great hotel at a very reasonable price. When I made my reservation I booked what the hotel calls a "Privilege Suite" for myself, my wife, and my ten month old son. The suite worked perfectly for my family. The suite was clean and spacious and the price for same was more than reasonable. I also found the staff at the hotel to be very helpful and courteous (as stated by many other Tripadvisor contributors). As for parking, unlike some other hotels at which I have stayed in Quebec access and egress to the parking garage was very simple and easy. I would even go so far as to say that the situation with parking served to enhance my experience. Now, as for the surrounding area I think some clarification is warranted on this subject. First off I will readily admit that the hotel is located close to the scruffier end of Rue Sainte Catherine Ouest near the Atwater Metro Station. However, the areas to the west and south of the hotel (not along Rue Sainte Catherine) are quiet and very nice. Everyone is quick to associate the hotel with Rue Sainte Catherine, but if you walk out of the hotel and instead of turning left towards Rue Sainte Catherine you turn right towards the residential neighborhoods close to the hotel you will find some beautiful homes along some very quiet streets. I especially liked the neighborhoods off of Rue Dorchester Ouest. Also, if you find the Atwater Metro Station not to your liking try the Georges-Vanier Metro Station which is about the same distance from the hotel. Just follow Rue du Fort south through the tunnel near the hotel and at the other end of the tunnel you will find the metro stop! Overall my experience at this hotel was excellent and I will definitely be returning some time in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Okay Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: amiashu
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good (not great). we asked for a king bed while booking at expedia but were given two queen beds (we knew that the request would be forwarded and there was no guarantee of the type of the bed in room) i asked the staff and they gave us a room with king bed next day. really good service and great front desk people. the cleanliness of some of the furniture could be questioned. i was not impressed much by the neighborhood, it is like not so great part of the downtown. there are many restaurants around. there is a movie theatre 2 blocks away. the metro stations are 2-3 blocks depending on which metro you want. overall the experience was okay. we went there just to relax and not shop or go around much. we stayed in hotel most of the time and found the rooms to be really cozy and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Hotel for a Weekend Getaway in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: sotter1811
Reviews.Content: Hotel Dufort offers great value for spacious rooms equipped with convenient kitchenettes, comfortable beds and spectacular views of the Montreal skyline. I love Hotel Dufort's location just steps away from the lively scene on Ste. Catherine Street, and a short walk to the Metro. You can count on Hotel Dufort's staff to be friendly, courteous, and efficient. This hotel is ideal for a weekend getaway and I look forward to staying there on my next trip to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Jerland
Reviews.Content: Nice staff, clean hotel, very comfortable bed. "extras" fairly expensive--$21 per day for parking, $11 per day for Internet, $11 for breakfast. Hotel is in a not so great part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “How can one improve on PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: Hawaiimaui88
Reviews.Content: We, and a group of family and friends were in Montreal for our son's wedding and used this hotel as 'base-camp'. The treatment we received was outstanding and nothing was too much for house-keeping, the concierge/front-desk, servers at breakfast or special services. Rooms were clean and quiet and effciency was the watch-word. We cannot compliment the staff nor recommend the hotel highly enough. Thanks Hotel du Fort!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Du Fort was a great location, friendly service and clean.”
Reviews.Author: Retro75
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Hotel Du Fort from the airport Via the 747 express Bus then only one stop on the Subway. Get off at Atwater subway station (The green line) as it's the closest and walk two blocks to the hotel. Don't use the George Vanier stop on the Orange line because of the huge Hill you will have to walk up to get to the hotel.(3 day unlimited transit pass is only $14.00 purchased at the currency exchange counter at the airport) There is a great mall at the Atwater station ALEXIS NIHON PLAZA that has (Zellers, Canadian tire, Winners, IGA Grocery store, AMC movies and much more). Downtown Montreal is only three short stops away on the subway, get off at MGill station you'll arrive right at the Eaton Center and all the shopping. Decent restaurants close by the hotel. Tuttti Frutti is a great breakfast and lunch spot on St Catherine across from the Atwater Subway station/Mall. It's not far via Bus to Mount Royal about 15 minutes give or take. The room itself was big, clean, a tiny bit retro but fun. The room had a fridge and microwave, coffee maker etc. The staff was very friendly and helpful to us when asking about things to do and directions. I would stay here again. Only downfall is the internet cost 10.99 per day. It should be free or at least per stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good starting point for exploring Montreal”
Reviews.Author: hushaphone
Reviews.Content: A nice small hotel that takes up a few floors of a high-rise on the west end of the downtown touristy section of Montreal. Good location between the Atwater and Georges-Vanier metro stops, just a few stations away from the oldest section of Montreal. Near bus lines, too. Clean rooms, very helpful and friendly staff. Did not eat the hotel breakfast; instead, went about 1 mile (you can drive or walk) downhill & west to the Atwater Marche, where we ate great pastries/baguettes at the Premiere Moisson patisserie at the south end of the building. (www.premieremoisson.com). I'm not exactly sure if we ended up using our AAA rate, but the package we got had Internet access and parking (easy & unlimited entry/exits) included (otherwise around $10 and $20 per day, respectively).

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the price”
Reviews.Author: Ethelberta
Reviews.Content: The "kids" (they were all very young) who worked at the front desk were all very sweet. Although I was informed that I could only have a smoking room through Hotwire, by the time we checked in, we had been switched to non-smoking, which we preferred. My biggest complaint is that not only was there no coffee to be had in the morning, when I stopped at the restaurant and asked to buy one to go, I was screamed at in French by a really surly host. He was ungodly nasty. And it's a good two blocks to find a cup of cofffee before 8 am.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price for a good location.”
Reviews.Author: silee
Reviews.Content: A good location downtown, my wife and I stayed for one night before moving to the hotel booked for a convention. Parts of the room were a bit dated and worn including the tv, and bathroom sink but overall the room was clean and comfortable. Paid extra to check in early after an overnight flight across the country and it was well worth the $50 to for both of us to manage 6 hours of sleep. Additional charge for internet seems behind the times and the single computer for public use in the booth of a business center was often occupied. The hotel provided recommendations for local restaurants in our room manual and we were provided with a small map which helped us to get to nearby St. Catherine's Street. Definitely a fair value no frills experience.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Service Experiences I have Ever had”
Reviews.Author: WarmWhite
Reviews.Content: My TripAdvisor followers know me as a tough but fair reviewer, and a seasoned one, having reviewed properties anywhere from Melbourne to Bangkok to Tel Aviv to Venice (both the original and the California one). I have stayed in some of the world's most luxurious hotels, but rarely did I find service that was as consistently good as at Hotel du Fort. I've interacted with the chambermaids, the handyman, the receptionists, the breakfast staff. Each of them made it a point to answer my questions promptly, to address requests and solves issues, to better my stay. Rarely have I encountered such consistently good service, let alone in an urban mid-range hotel. The rooms and facilities are typical of its class, but the service is suitable for the Four Seasons, the Peninsula, the St. Regis. I salute you!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for downtown Montreal.”
Reviews.Author: familytravel4x4
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in August. Clean, quiet hotel in a good location - plenty of restaurants within walking distance. We had a classic room with 2 double beds which was fine for the 4 of us. Hotel staff were very helpful and recommended restaurants in the area. Had the buffet breakfast each morning which was fine (croissants delicious) and about the same price as other places around. If we ever visit Montreal again would happily stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Downtown!”
Reviews.Author: hisankles
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at the Hotel Du Fort. We booked a Signature suite with a king sized bed. The room was pretty large for a city hotel. It had a sofa with a pull out couch, a separate small chair, a desk with chair, a nice sized TV, and a mini kitchenette with a refrigerator and microwave. I thought the bed and pillows were very comfortable unlike other reviews have stated. Our room was on the 12th floor and we had a nice view of the city. The buildings around may scare you, but we walked the main street which the hotel is located on late at night and we felt safe. Check in and out went very smoothly and all the staff was extremely friendly. The parking lot was right next door underground and connected to the hotel through an elevator (parking was free with the package we booked). I highly recommend this hotel. We will be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, central and curtious are the words i use to describe the Fort Hotel”
Reviews.Author: anniepieannie
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to everyone. I really enjoyed staying here and found everything to be very good.

Reviews.Title: “OK experience”
Reviews.Author: Tom_M
Reviews.Content: Pro: Somewhat near metro, kitchenette, helpfull staff, Con: We had a smelly smoking room, $20/day parking, $11/day Internet There are worse hotels, but the smelly room was a turnoff. The room and it's furnishings were getting a little worn..

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Convenient Downtown Location”
Reviews.Author: globo8
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying at Hotel du Fort after booking on Hotwire and were very pleased. The room had a great view of the city and a good location. First impression of the neighborhood was not that great, but we ended up feeling very comfortable in the area (even with an infant). Hotel staff was always very friendly. It's a hike from Old Montreal, but it was close to grocery stores, restaurants/bars, shops, and the metro. The room was clean and worked well. Parking was about 20 US dollars a night, but probably not too many other good options for that. Overall we had a great stay and would recommend Hotel du Fort!

Reviews.Title: “Book This Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: DebiMississauga
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Montreal over the July long weekend and had done extensive research on hotels in the downtown area. We looked at many of the TripAdvisor reviews and after considerable deliberation decided to take a chance on the Hotel du Fort. Upon our early arrival, we were pleased to find that our room was ready for check-in. We were more than pleasantly surprised at the size of the accomodations. It wasn't the Ritz, but it was more than roomy and comfortable with many amenities that we appreciated. The location is a little to the outside of downtown (but still downtown), and it was easy to reach buses and the subway lines to get us everywhere we wanted to go. We also did the walk to central downtown which took approximately 20 minutes at a leisurely pace. The Hotel included our buffet breakfasts all three mornings of our stay and they were very adequate - plenty of variety to suit all tastes. I must give a shout out to Sabrina at the front desk who exhaustively answered all our myriad questions about the transportation systems and venue locations. She certainly went above and beyond our expectations of front desk staff. Also, Mathieu was very helpful as were the rest of the staff. We discovered a little gem of a restaurant just on the corner from our hotel - a sports bar called 'La Station Des Sports'. Prices here were very reasonable and the portions huge. We traveled to Montreal on the train so did not have to deal with the parking issues as mentioned in previous reviews. Overall, our experience in Montreal was peppered with helpful conversations from the locals with extremely friendly attitudes. These made it a refreshing change from our last visit. Sincerely, do not hesitate to book this hotel. It is well worth the value.

Reviews.Title: “Average but reasonable value”
Reviews.Author: Europamonkey
Reviews.Content: I came to Montreal for a conference over a weekend in late June. Hotel rooms were hard to find that weekend, possibly due to the Jazz Festival being on. The Hotel du Fort was not in a good position for the conference at the Palais des Congres, at least a 30 min walk, or a metro ride. The area around the hotel seemed a bit shabby, though only a few blocks from shops along Rue Ste Catherine, and plenty of good bars and restaurants along that way too. Check in and check out were smooth, and the receptionist charming. The room was clean and a good size, but clearly well worn with carpet stains and mould in the bathroom. The air con was noisy, the curtains didn't close fully, and the bed was hard with two thin foam pillows - not the best hotel sleep quality. Housekeeping was efficient, although the coffee mugs were left for me to clean in the kitchenette. All that said, it's reasonably good value at $140 pn on a peak weekend, and I wasn't irritated enough to complain, so will leave this review as strictly average, and you can probably do better.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Myrna90
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Hotel du Fort a number of times and each time we have received the best of service and care. It is centrally located. The staff is courteous and knowledgeable, the rooms are good sized and clean with little kitchenettes so you can have a snack and relax in your room. The breakfast room is a real treat with a good selection of foods and pleasant service. We tried another hotel for one stay but we came back to the du Fort because of its friendliness and service.

Reviews.Title: “surprisingly good, lifted by great staff”
Reviews.Author: golsonic
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights, taking breakfast in the hotel. The location is fine, close to plenty of shops and restaurants, as well as metro stations on both lines into the centre of the city. You can walk to the old town and main tourist sites if you are fairly fit, but otherwise it might be a bit far on foot. The staff all seem great, with special plaudits to the reception staff and the breakfast buffet crew. The breakfast is basically continental, with only scrambled egg or oatmeal as hot options, but there are plenty of breads, pastries, fruits, cereals etc, and the staff are really on the ball. The rooms and common areas don't have much "character" as they all modern and functional, but the quality is good, and the housekeeping is excellent. You will have to pay extra for parking - which is just next door in an underground car park, and also for the internet. So, overall, no real wow factor but the hotel delivers everything you need, and does so through friendly, cheerful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very average.”
Reviews.Author: Jeff073
Reviews.Content: My wife and i booked a weekend in Montreal for our anniversary. We ended up staying here because the price was right and the location was excellent. The hotel is advertised with excellent views of down town Montreal, while this is true our first room had an excellent view across the alley into an office, complete with some poor guy working away. We asked to have our room changed and it was without delay. The rooms are old and dated, but the hotel is going through renovations. While clean the carpets are worn as is the furniture. The only other thing of note is we had a fire alarm at 8 in the morning on Saturday. While that was nobody fault perse. It did rather ruin our experience with the hotel. Nothing like walking down 18 flights of stairs after a late night and too much wine. Montreal is a great town and i would recommend a suite at this hotel for a small family, i would not recommend it for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: starfish08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took the train from Toronto to Montreal for the weekend and stayed at Hotel du Fort. We had booked a superior room but when we arrived, were offered a suite for $20 extra a night. The room was quite big and had a separate living room with tv, bar area, with fridge and microwave. There was a pull out couch in the room as well. The bedroom was separate and the king size bed quite comfortable. What we liked best about this hotel was the location. We were about 6 blocks away from Crescent street which was great since it wasn't as crazy near our hotel as the ones closer to Crescent. We pretty much walked everywhere or took the Metro (also close). All in all, we would stay here again because of the location and price.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent, conveniently located hotel”
Reviews.Author: benmabetti
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent, conveniently located hotel, small enough to be friendly, and big enough to be entirely professional. They are very conscious of competitive pricing and offer rooms slightly lower than their nearest rivals. I have stayed there twice and look forward to doing so again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: MarylandNed
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. I was in Montreal with my 2 teenage daughters visiting McGill University as part of a larger college visiting road trip. We stayed 2 nights. The hotel was great and the staff friendly. It's in a great location - close to bars, restaurants, subway stations and entertainment. The Forum (where the Montreal Canadiens used to play ice hockey) is nearby and has been converted into a shopping complex complete with restaurants and cinema. My main gripe was having to pay $10 per day for WiFi. However, they did allow us to hook up multiple devices (laptop and iPod) at no additional cost.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location!”
Reviews.Author: JMMRPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel in downtown Montreal is just perfect for an exciting night life and daytime shopping experience.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Pacificstandard
Reviews.Content: I know Montreal pretty well. Live in the western suburbs. Surprised my girlfriend around Valentine's Day booking a several nights at the Hotel du Fort. We had a very spacious room. Included a separate large bedroom with glass doors. Two bathrooms. Very comfortable King Size bed with two extra pillows in the closet, two house coats. Small fridge (empty - thanks) microwave oven, sink, set of dishes and kitchenware hidden away in a closeted kitchenette. Really like comfy apartment. Believe this is the best value for quality accommodation in Montreal. Paid in the $130's per night with caa discount. Checked out several hotels in town before choosing this one. Truly an outstanding value. The Hotel is located on Fort Street and St Catherine Street, in an area on the western side of Downtown with lots of university and college students. Concordia University, Dawson College, Lasalle College. There are lots of restaurants around here. Cuisine from many different countries. In particular there are some very good chinese and other asian restaurants. Prices are reasonable. Parking is extra, but is a very good value. The subway stations are nearby and the access to the highway (20) is nearby. Good shopping nearby. St Catherine, guy street, fauborg, alexis Nihon, greene avenue and westmount square. The Hotel lobby is small the hotel rooms start on about the 11th floor. There is no noise from traffic. This is a very quiet place. We ended up with one of our kids the first night. Came late. Called the front desk. No charge extra for a child. Housekeeping came up right away (at night) and prepared the bedding on the pull out sofa bed in the living room. Very fast friendly housekeeping service. Much appreciated. This place was spotlessly clean. Great view of the city. Wi fi internet was free. Fitness centre was small but well equipped and was free to use. They have a business centre. Staff were very helpful and pleasant. Recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: cameramn4
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to MontrÃ©al, and without any personal testimonials, we relied heavily on Internet research and intuition. But Hotel du Fort lived up to the reviews, starting with the friendly and accommodating reservationist, and ending after check out with their follow-up email. The entire staff was warm, welcoming, and helpful, whether honoring our request for a room with a view, or suggesting the best options for local cuisine. The room was perfect, providing a beautiful, nighttime skyline of the city and cozy, comfortable accommodations. Admittedly, the location may not suit everyone. Itâ€™s outside the heart of the city and the neighborhood reflects an eclectic socio-economic mix. But itâ€™s here that youâ€™ll experience the true essence of the MontrÃ©al, known for its variety of cultures and cuisines. Besides, the Metro is just a few blocks away. If your plans call for a long weekend getaway to this fascinating city, Hotel du Fort is worth consideration. Befriend the staff, note their advice, and donâ€™t take this long to post a review.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: elicyn
Reviews.Content: Based on other reviews and a very reasonable price I booked a four night stay at Hotel Du Fort Feb 2 - 6, 2010. The Montreal Museum of Fine Art is a 10 - 15 minute walk to the end of Rue Du Fort and right at the top of the hill to Sherbrooke. Rue Sainte Catherine which is at the corner and intersects Rue Du Fort offers lots of shops and restaurants as well as a metro stop which is about four blocks from the hotel. The hotel and room were very clean despite the constant grime and sludge the city endures during the winter months. Staff are professional, polite and very helpful and can arrange taxis, help you with directions, arrange sightseeing, etc. I stayed in a 15th floor non-smoking standard room with queen bed. There is a work desk (internet connection for a fee), cozy seating area with table, large screen TV, very clean bathroom, good views and a hideaway kitchenette with a mini fridge and microwave. Because Montreal is an expensive city to visit, this feature helped a lot. Though the hotel serves breakfast in the Hotel du Fort complex for an extra fee, eating breakfast in the room was quick and easy especially since there is a nice clean grocery store on the corner of Sainte Catherine. The room is well appointed with a large mirrored closet with iron, ironing board and safe. Though I was staying there alone, the bathroom was adequately stocked with towels and washcloths and they all smelled fresh and clean like detergent - quite refreshing considering how most hotel linens smell. The bed was comfortable and the long entry way into the room with the closet and kitchenette in the front afford a lot of privacy. I had only two complaints. Noise the first morning from hammering and banging, though I am a late riser so most guests were probably not bothered. There was also random popping or banging noises through the night which I assumed came from the heater which was on the duration of my stay. That with the occasional repetetive door slamming of the neighbors made one day a bit hard to relax. The only other flaw I see with the accommodation is that the hair dryer cord is stapled to the back of the drawer housing the light up vanity mirror. This left little of the cord to reach outside the drawer so I had to bend at an odd angle to try to dry my hair which is both thick and long. This left me frustrated and heading out into the very cold temperatures with damp hair each day. Otherwise, this was a thoroughly pleasant stay and I would highly recommend Hotel Du Fort. The location is great, the hotel is much cleaner than higher priced chain 'luxury' hotels nearby and the staff is gracious and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: steplulu
Reviews.Content: Booked directly with the Hotel, exchange a few emails and the customer service very good, Peggy very helpful and answer all my qeries without any unhappy. Room good size(Deluxe), we paid $130 Canadian Dollars per room without breakfast. Close to Subways station. The problem is you need walk through the tunnel about 5 mins for highup walk!! From station walk to the hotel about 10 mins. Tip: Another station nearby and you don't need walk through the tunnel, you need change the line not direct to the hotel is the problem!! Not much trouble, many restaurant nearby the hotel, post office and supermarket very close too. Although not too close to downtown but the subway very easy to catch and cheap too. Happy our stayes at Hotel Du Fort

Reviews.Title: “Will defintely stay at Hotel Du Fort again.”
Reviews.Author: yankeegirl46
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of the mostly postive reviews here, and I wasn't disappointed. I think it's a pretty good value compared to nearby places. We had one of the smaller rooms but it was still plenty big enough, with a small kitchenette hidden behind folding doors. (And a little coffeepot plus a real mug and spoon!) Everything was clean, and we had a wonderful view from our window. There were a lot of restaurants within a few blocks; maybe not the really nicehigh-end places, but moderately priced places, with lots of ethnic food choices. The old city was a bit far for us to walk to, but we just drove down and parked in that big lot by the water. I'd skip the breakfast buffet and go to Tutti Fruitti instead - it's about three blocks away on St. Catherine.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Comfortable Hotel With Some Issues”
Reviews.Author: intrepidtrav
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel du Fort Montreal for a one week vacation this past August. The hotel is located on Rue(Street) Fort right off St. Catherine, the main commercial street in the city. Please note that this section of St, Catherine is not the commercial downtown section with all the chic shops and restaurants - rather, the area where the hotel is located is a largely residential, quieter section of Montreal - not a bad thing as you will find many interesting shops and boutiques and reasonably priced restaurants here.The hotel is about 20 minutes walking distance from downtown; there are also three Metro stations within a three to four block radius of the Hotel du Fort (Atwater, Guy Concordia and Georges-Vanier) to get you anywhere in the city you want to go. The Georges-Vanier station is just two stops away from the Central train station for those arriving or leaving Montreal by train. As for the hotel itself, it is a medium-sized residential-style property with large, spacious and quite comfortable rooms with spectacular views of the city especially from the upper floors. The room type I stayed in was the King Signature which had a siiting area with a sofa and lounge chair.A wooden divider with a makeup table, lamp and hair dryer separated this living area from the sleeping area which contained the bed and a small chair. In addition, the room contains a large desk, armoire with a TV and dresser drawers, a large closet, a kitchenette with refrigerator, and a good-sized bathroom. The bathroom was well-appointed with such convieniences as seperate switches for the light and the fan, safety bars in the shower, a non-slip tub floor and a laundry line, features which are not always found in more expensive properties, at least not all in one room. That said, this bathroom had two items which I found rather disappoiting - a very powerful shower with a narrow water jet which was anything but comfortable (and non-adjustable). Also, instead of the usual bottles of toiletries, there were wall dispensers in the shower for shampoo, soap, etc. Perhaps the hotel is trying to be enviromentally freindly but I found this rather cheesy and motel-like for hotel of this caliber. One other observation regarding the room - the website indicates all the rooms have flatscreen TVs - this turns out not to be the case. When I asked the manager on duty about this he said that those TVs are only in the suites. This may be important to some, not so much to others, but I thought I should mention it. Now, to the issues I alluded to in the title of my review. These concern the breakfast and the business center. The breakfast buffet (no ala carte menu available) served in a very elegant room with large picture windows is described on the website as having hot and cold items - in truth, the only hot item every morning was scrambled eggs. The other items were of the continental variety - fruit, pastries, cold cuts juice, coffee. The breakfast was certainly not bad, but for the price $9.95 CAD I did expect a bit more. As to the business center, (located right off the breakfast room) please note that there is only one computer available fro everyone's use. During my stay, I usually had to wait longer than usual to use the computer; this experience culminated one night with several guests inckud- ing myself complaining about one guest hogging the computer for over an hour. To the hotel's everlasting credit, the front desk staff remedied this situation immediatel and removed the offender. Also to their credit, I recently received a letter fron the hotel manager apologiz- ing for my experience in this matter and told me that the computer use policy has since been revised to allow each guest 15 minutes use on said computer, and in addition I was offered a complimentary room upgrade for a future stay. I sincerely hope that this policy will be adher- ed to and respected by all the guests. What this would mean is how much of a priority the use of the business center is to you during your vacation. The front desk staff was very freindly and efficient in all other matters as well. They made me feel very welcome and made many recommendations for my sightseeing, restaurant and transportation needs while in Montreal. In regard to the latter, the concierge can furnish you with an Opus card for $5.00 which is good for unlimited trips on the city's subways and buses. You can refill the card yourself when the encoded value runs out. You must return the card at checkout or you will be charged the $5.00 on your bill. The housekeeping staff were also excellent except for an unknown housekeeper who (with good intentions I'm sure) left my room windows open on the two hottest days of my stay. This was not a big issue though and I let it pass. In summary, the Hotel du Fort is a very pleasant hotel to stay in. Centrally located in a quaint, quiet neighborhood, it has large comfortable rooms, a caring staff and reasonable rates. And if the above issue with the business center are indeed resolved, then the hotel will be even more inviting. P.S. For those of you looking for additional shopping and dining, there is a large shopping mall three blocks from the hotel. It is the Place Alexis-Nihon and contains a McDonalds (good for breakfast and sinfully delicious pastries - believe me on this!), a food court and shops for all your needs, especially the basic things you may need for your trip. It is located atop the Atwater Metro station and across the street from the Pepsi Forum (a huge sports-entertainment complex).

Reviews.Title: “A Small Apartment - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: FloridaFunAdventurer
Reviews.Content: Great time in Montreal. Hotel is older and was like having a small, comfy apartment in the city. We had a huge corner room with a kitchenette, bedroom, dining room and living room - extremely comfortable. It's right off St. Catherine Blvd. where we walked to restaurants and the center of the city. We chose to take a taxi to Old Montreal vs. drive. It's too far to walk. The breakfast is in a lovely dining room and was okay at $9.95, but we typically had breakfast in our room. A grocery store is across the street. Free internet was great and parking was only $18 a day. The halls had a little musty smell, but we didn't notice it in our very clean room. It was a little dated, but very comfortable and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & convenient”
Reviews.Author: CR0726
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night at the Hotel du Fort but we wished we'd booked for longer. Stayed here on our annual trip to drop our son off at McGill. It was not too far from his apartment and convenient to the Metro and downtown. The room was huge, bed comfortable, price reasonable. Parking was convenient and about the going rate for a city hotel (around $18 I think). Nice view of downtown. The exercise room was nice and well equipped but for some odd reason the treadmill was locked and required a special key from the front desk. My only complaint is the for-fee internet access. I HATE paying for internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: smacproductions
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was very courteous & helpful. Room was clean, large & had a beautiful view. Kitchenette was clean & very appreciated. In-room safe was a great feature. Location was close enough to some sites & very accessible by Metro for farther sights. I will stay here again & recommend it highly. After staying at a horrible hotel in Ottawa on the same trip, Hotel Du Fort was refreshing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay right in the center of Montreal”
Reviews.Author: nma123
Reviews.Content: I have selected the hotel based on reviews on Tripadvisor and it turned out pretty good. We stayed 4 days. It is located next to St Catherine street which is walking distance to shopping centers, great restautants and underground city. There were two grocery stores accross hotel. Hotel is about 5 min walk to the subway which was very convenient for us coming to the hotel from the train station, as well as travelling to botanical garden and Olympic Stadium.
